ovdesc.p: ELIGIBILITY property class is currently used for ACCOUNTS, LENDING and DEPOSITS product line.
This property class is used to evaluate eligibility of a customer for the product based on the rules defined.
The eligibility evaluation will be triggered at a given frequency or when there is a static change for the customer.
Upon any failure of a rule during eligibility review process, the arrangement will be moved from the current product to a default product as per the setup.
1. EB.CONTEXT must have an entry for each T24 application, whose field values are used to evaluate a condition.

2. Toolbox can be used as an external interface to create rules and save it to T24 so that XML format of the rules will be automatically downloaded to the applications EB.RULES.VERSION and EB.RULES in T24.

3. Technically to communicate to T24 we need an entry in EB.RULE.GATEWAY for each rule(shouldn’t define more than one rule). ELIGIBILITY property class uses the id of EB.RULE.GATEWAY as a key to trigger rule engine.

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.

The default product to which the arrangement has to be moved on rule failure during cob.

This field indicates the system’s behavior for a rule failure during cob. The rule evaluation process will be triggered during cob based on the frequency or any static change to the customer. Valid options are CHANGE.PRODUCT and IGNORE. If CHANGE.PRODUCT is set, then during cob on rule failure, the arrangement will move to the default product specified.
If IGNORE is set, then during cob on rule failure, arrangement will still remain under the current product only.
